sections.title: What this section covers
sections.content:
Many English words are often misspelt because of silent letters, double letters, or confusing letter patterns (e.g. ie/ei, -ence/-ance). This section focuses on **50 commonly misspelt words** that learners and native speakers often get wrong.

You will see the full word list below, then in the **check** you can test your recognition, and in **practice** you will correct sentences that contain one or more misspellings of these words.

Tip: Learn words in small groups, and notice patterns (e.g. receive, believe – 'i before e except after c' in receive; double letters in accommodation, necessary).

sections.title: The word list (50 words)
sections.content:
Learn and revise these commonly misspelt words. They will appear in the practice sentences with typical spelling mistakes for you to correct.

**1–10:** accommodation, achieve, across, address, aggressive, apparently, appearance, argument, beginning, believe

**11–20:** business, calendar, category, ceiling, conscience, conscious, definitely, desperate, difference, disappoint

**21–30:** discipline, embarrass, existence, experience, February, foreign, friend, government, harass, height

**31–40:** immediately, independent, knowledge, license, maintenance, necessary, neighbour, occasion, occurrence, piece

**41–50:** privilege, pronunciation, receive, recommend, restaurant, rhythm, separate, surprise, weird

questions.question: Spell this word correctly: accomodation
questions.explanation: Accommodation has double c and double m.

questions.question: Spell this word correctly: recieve
questions.explanation: Receive: i before e except after c.

questions.question: Spell this word correctly: definately
questions.explanation: Definitely has -ite- in the middle, from 'finite'.

questions.question: Spell this word correctly: neccessary
questions.explanation: Necessary: one c, double s (one collar, two sleeves).

questions.question: Spell this word correctly: seperate
Wrong: 'We need accomodation for two nights.' Correct the sentence.
answers: We need accommodation for two nights.
questions.explanation: Accommodation has double c and double m.

questions.question: Wrong: 'She managed to acheive her goal.' Correct the sentence.
answers: She managed to achieve her goal.

questions.question: Wrong: 'We walked accross the road.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'Please send your adress.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'He was very agressive.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'She was apparantly very tired.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'His appearence had changed.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'They had an arguement.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Argument: no e after u (argue → argument).

questions.question: Wrong: 'From the begining, it was clear.' Correct the sentence.
answers: From the beginning, it was clear.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I can't beleive it.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'It's none of your buisness.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'Check the calender for the date.' Correct the sentence.
answers: Check the calendar for the date.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Which catagory does it belong to?' Correct the sentence.
answers: Which category does it belong to?

questions.question: Wrong: 'There was a leak in the cieling.' Correct the sentence.
answers: There was a leak in the ceiling.

questions.question: Wrong: 'His consience troubled him.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'She was concious of the risk.' Correct the sentence.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I will definately be there.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'They were desparate for help.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'What's the diffrence?' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'Don't dissapoint them.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'It takes disipline to succeed.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'She didn't want to embarass him.' Correct the sentence.
answers: She didn't want to embarrass him.

questions.question: Wrong: 'The existance of life on other planets.' Correct the sentence.
answers: The existence of life on other planets.

questions.question: Wrong: 'She has a lot of experiance.' Correct the sentence.
answers: She has a lot of experience.

questions.question: Wrong: 'We're going in Febuary.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'It's a foriegn language.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'She's my best freind.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'The goverment announced new plans.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'You must not harrass people.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'What's the hight of the building?' Correct the sentence.

Wrong: 'He has a lot of knowlege.' Correct the sentence.
answers: He has a lot of knowledge.

answers: You need a license to drive.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Regular maintainance is required.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'It's neccessary to book in advance.' Correct the sentence.
answers: It's necessary to book in advance.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Our neigbour is very kind.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'On this occassion we will celebrate.' Correct the sentence.
answers: On this occasion we will celebrate.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Such an occurance is rare.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'Would you like a peice of cake?' Correct the sentence.
answers: Would you like a piece of cake?

questions.question: Wrong: 'It was a great priviledge to meet her.' Correct the sentence.
answers: It was a great privilege to meet her.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Your pronounciation is very good.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'I recieved your letter.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Receive: i before e except after c.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I would recomend the fish.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'We had dinner at a restuarant.' Correct the sentence.
answers: We had dinner at a restaurant.

questions.question: Wrong: 'She has a good sense of rythm.' Correct the sentence.
answers: She has a good sense of rhythm.
questions.explanation: Rhythm: no vowel between th and m (rh-y-th-m).

questions.question: Wrong: 'Keep them seperate.' Correct the sentence.
Wrong: 'It was a complete suprise.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Surprise: double r, -ise (not -ize in this word).

questions.question: Wrong: 'That's a wierd story.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Weird: e before i (exception to the rule).

questions.question: Wrong: 'We need accomodation and the restuarant is full.' Correct the sentence.
answers: We need accommodation and the restaurant is full.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I definately believe it was necessary.' Correct the sentence.
answers: I definitely believe it was necessary.
